summary: The document pertains to the Assassination Records Review Board's final determination on the HSCA's staff payroll records, highlighting the partial postponement of information due to historical significance and privacy concerns, specifically the redaction of Social Security numbers. It details the resignation of Stephen J. Fallis on September 12, 1977, and outlines his distinguished legal career, including his education at Harvard Law School and Columbia College, and his professional roles such as Bureau Chief in the Office of the Special State Prosecutor and Assistant District Attorney in New York County.
key_findings: Partial postponement of the document was justified by its historical interest and the lack of potential harm from its release.
Redaction of Social Security numbers was implemented to safeguard personal privacy.
Stephen J. Fallis resigned from his position on September 12, 1977.
Fallis's legal career was notable, featuring significant roles in the Office of the Special State Prosecutor and the New York County District Attorney's Office.
keywords: Office of the Special State Prosecutor
New York County District Attorney's Office
